Declarative parallel dataflow with Future/Furrr and SLURM utilities

parade.Rd

The parade package provides a declarative, lazy, and compositional approach to parallel dataflow in R. Built on top of the future/furrr ecosystem, it offers typed schemas, artifact management, diagnostics, and HPC-friendly distribution including seamless SLURM integration via future.batchtools.

Details

Key features include:

  • Typed dataflow pipelines with dependency management

  • Local and SLURM distributed execution

  • Artifact persistence with automatic metadata

  • Real-time job monitoring and dashboards

  • Configurable resource management with profiles

  • Comprehensive error handling and diagnostics

See also

Core functions: flow(), stage(), collect(), submit() Distribution: dist_local(), dist_slurm(), distribute() Configuration: parade_config_read(), slurm_defaults_set() Monitoring: script_top(), jobs_top(), script_metrics()

Author

Maintainer: Parade Authors parade@example.org
